parts.text:
```json
{
"application": "Slurm",
"details": {
"scheduler": "Slurm",
"job_name": "perl@5.32.0",
"account": "use300",
"partition": "ind-gpu-shared",
"nodes": 1,
"tasks_per_node": 1,
"cpus_per_task": 10,
"memory": "93G",
"gpus": 1,
"time": "00:30:00",
"spack_version": "0.17.3",
"spack_instance_name": "gpu",
"spack_instance_dir": "${HOME}/cm/shared/apps/spack/${SPACK_VERSION}/${SPACK_INSTANCE_NAME}",
"spack_package": "perl@5.32.0",
"spack_compiler": "gcc@10.2.0",
"spack_variants": "+cpanm +shared +threads",
"spack_dependencies": "",
"spack_spec": "${SPACK_PACKAGE} % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ${SPACK_VARIANTS} ${SPACK_DEPENDENCIES}",
"dependent_job": "tcl@8.6.11.sh"
}
}
```

This script uses **Slurm** as a scheduler. It configures a job with specific resources and dependencies. The script utilizes **Spack**, a package manager, to install the **perl** package.
